title: How to restore my iPod Classic without iTunes - Quora

response.answer_text: Restoring iPod Classic Without iTunes (Solved!!!)My last be all and end all try was to try and reformat the iPod through Windows, by right-clicking the iPod drive and selecting format. NOTE: I saved all my music off the iPod by showing hidden files, going into ipod_control folder and dragging the music folder and playlist on my PC. (I am not going into detail here, I assume everyone checking this out is computer savvy) I didnt change any of the settings, I just clicked start with quick format selected and of course everything got deleted off, which is normal. I removed the iPod, put the iPod into Disk Mode, by pressing the menu/center button until the apple logo appears and then quickly pressing the center/play buttons until you see a check mark with a Disk Mode message. Then connected iPod to PC Started iTunes, sure enough iTunes recognized the iPod, but gave a message that the iPod is corrupted and needs to be Restored with updated software. Clicked restore in iTunes, takes a couple minutes to update and voila. I then dragged the music files I saved on my PC, with the playlist back onto the iPod through Windows, not in iTunes and everything is back to normal.

You don’t. iOS has the necessary bits to perform restores and updates without the external support that a computer provides. Pre-iOS devices like iPod nano, iPod shuffle, and iPod classic don’t have iOS and, as such, need iTunes to help facilitate a restore to factory settings.

The short answer is, “You can't.” Technically, there are work-arounds, but they all involve using a computer. If you have a computer, why not install iTunes (it's free) and do it the easy way? If you don't have a computer, the iPod Classic can't be reset.
